PMC11502629 PMC11502629.1 11502629 11502629 39388689 10.1089/jamp.2024.0002 10.1089/jamp.2024.0002 1 Original Research Suboptimal Peak Inspiratory Flow in Patients Hospitalized for COPD Exacerbation: Prevalence and Predictive Factors GONZÁLEZ-MONTAOS ET AL. SUBOPTIMAL PIF IN PATIENTS HOSPITALIZED FOR AECOPD González-Montaos Almudena MD  1  2 https://orcid.org/0000-0003-2942-0714 Pazos-Area Luis MD  1  2 Represas-Represas Cristina PhD  1  2  3 Ramos-Hernández Cristina PhD  1  2 Lojo-Rodríguez Irene MD  1  2 Priegue-Carrera Ana RN  2 Aballe-Santos Luz RN  1 Fernández-Villar Alberto PhD  1  2  3  1  2  3 Address correspondence to: Cristina Represas-Represas Pulmonology Department, Álvaro Cunqueiro University Hospital, Vigo, Galicia, Spain cristina.represas.represas@sergas.es i https://orcid.org/0000-0003-2942-0714 10 2024 03 10 2024 37 5 473513 225 231 14 1 2024 Received on January 14, 2024 15 5 2024 in final form, May 15, 2024 03 10 2025 03 10 2025 26 10 2024 03 10 2025 Copyright 2024, Mary Ann Liebert, Inc., publishers 2024 Mary Ann Liebert, Inc., publishers Introduction: Despite the importance of an adequate peak inspiratory flow (PIF) during inhaled therapy in patients with COPD, the available evidence in patients with severe exacerbations and their evolution after admission is limited. We conducted this study to evaluate the PIF during an exacerbation, its variability, and predictors of suboptimal PIF. Material and Methods: A prospective study that included patients admitted for COPD exacerbation. Clinical, demographic, and functional variables were recorded. Using the In-Check DIAL G16 ® Results: A total of 137 patients were included; 27% were women and the mean age was 69.4 ± 9.8 years. Moreover, 30.8% of the participants with dry powder inhalers had a suboptimal PIF at admission and it was independently associated with female sex (odds ratio [OR] = 8.635; 95% confidence interval [CI] [2.007, 37.152]; p p p Conclusion: One third of COPD patients admitted with a severe exacerbation had a suboptimal PIF, being female sex and lower FEV1 independent predictors. PIF-nr improved progressively after the exacerbation.
